name.baseName: cement production;cement, portland cement;post-combustion CO2 capture
水泥生产;水泥, 硅酸盐水泥;燃烧后二氧化碳捕获

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Cement production with post-combustion carbon capture and storage (CCS).For post-combustion CO2 capture technology, a CO2 separation process is added before the fluegas is discharged to the atmosphere. The separated high-purity CO2, after being compressed, canthen be transported and stored. Chemical absorption is currently the most widely used method forcapturing CO2 from low pressure and low concentration flue gases, and MonoEthanolAmine (MEA) is the most widely useochemical adsorbent. Therefore, the MEA adsorption method was selected as a case study forpost-combustion CO2 capture technology. Extra energy is required for MEA CO2 capture because MEA has to be regenerated by a large amount of low-pressure steam after the CO2 has been absorbed in the MEA. We assumed that steam will be supplied by an onsite combined heat and power (CHP) plantand that the plant can also meet the power requirements of the post-combustion capture process ancother production processes in the cement plant. NOx and SO2 in the kiln flue gas can have negativeimpacts on the MEA absorption process, so they have to be reduced to the required level before theflue gas is passed to the CO2 capture unit. A selective catalytic reduction (SCR) unit isconsidered to eliminate NOx and a flue gas desulphurization (FDG) unit is considered to remove SO2 from the flue gas.

采用后燃烧碳捕集和储存（post-combustion carbon capture and storage）技术的水泥生产。对于燃烧后CO2捕集技术，排放到大气之前添加CO2分离过程。分离后的高纯度CO2经过压缩后可以进行运输和储存。化学吸收目前是从低压和低浓度烟气中捕集CO2的最常用方法，MonoEthanolAmine（MEA）是最常用的吸附剂。因此，MEA吸附方法被选为燃烧后CO2捕集技术的案例研究。MEA CO2捕集需要额外的能量，因为CO2被MEA吸收后需要大量的低压蒸汽对MEA进行再生。我们假设蒸汽将由现场的联合发电工厂供应，并且该工厂还可以满足水泥工厂的燃烧后捕集过程和其他生产过程的电力需求。窑气中的NOx和SO2会对MEA吸收过程产生负面影响，因此在将烟气传递到CO2捕集单元之前，它们必须降到所需水平。选择性催化还原（Selective catalytic reduction，SCR）单元被考虑用于消除NOx，烟气脱硫单元被考虑用于从烟气中去除SO2。

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: For post-combustion CO, capture technology, a CO, separation process is added before the fluegas is discharged to the atmosphere. The separated high-purity CO,, after being compressed, canthen be transported and stored. Chemical absorption is currently the most widely used method forcapturing CO, from low pressure and low concentration flue gases, and MEA is the most widely useochemical adsorbent (191. Therefore, the MEA adsorption method was selected as a case study forpost-combustion CO, capture technology. Extra energy is required for MEA CO, capture because MEAhas to be regenerated by a large amount of low-pressure steam after the CO, has been absorbed in theMEA. We assumed that steam will be supplied by an onsite combined heat and power (CHP) plantand that the plant can also meet the power requirements of the post-combustion capture process ancother production processes in the cement plant. NOx and SO, in the kiln flue gas can have negativeimpacts on the MEA absorption process, so they have to be reduced to the required level before theflue gas is passed to the CO capture unit. In this study, a selective catalytic reduction (SCR) unit isconsidered to eliminate NO and a flue gas desulphurization (FDG) unit is considered to remove SOfrom the flue gas.

For post-combustion CO, capture technology, a CO, separation process is added before the fluegas is discharged to the atmosphere. The separated high-purity CO,, after being compressed, canthen be transported and stored. Chemical absorption is currently the most widely used method forcapturing CO, from low pressure and low concentration flue gases, and MEA is the most widely useochemical adsorbent (191. Therefore, the MEA adsorption method was selected as a case study forpost-combustion CO, capture technology. Extra energy is required for MEA CO, capture because MEAhas to be regenerated by a large amount of low-pressure steam after the CO, has been absorbed in theMEA. We assumed that steam will be supplied by an onsite combined heat and power (CHP) plantand that the plant can also meet the power requirements of the post-combustion capture process ancother production processes in the cement plant. NOx and SO, in the kiln flue gas can have negativeimpacts on the MEA absorption process, so they have to be reduced to the required level before theflue gas is passed to the CO capture unit. In this study, a selective catalytic reduction (SCR) unit isconsidered to eliminate NO and a flue gas desulphurization (FDG) unit is considered to remove SOfrom the flue gas.
technology.technologicalApplicability: The Portland cement production process described is intended for the manufacturing of cement with a production capacity of 1 million tons per year. The process incorporates post-combustion carbon capture and storage (CCS) to mitigate CO2 emissions, utilizing MonoEthanolAmine (MEA) as the chemical adsorbent. It is specifically engineered for applications where CO2 emission reduction is targeted, such as in environments with strict emission regulations. The cement produced, with 91% clinker content, is suitable for construction purposes with considerations of reduced environmental impact.
本描述的硅酸盐水泥生产过程旨在每年生产100万吨水泥。该过程融合了燃烧后二氧化碳捕获和储存（CCS）技术，以减少CO2排放，使用的化学吸附剂为单乙醇胺（MEA）。它专门为目标是减少CO2排放的应用设计，如在严格排放法规的环境中。所生产的水泥含91%熟料，适用于考虑减少环境影响的建筑用途。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Jing An, Richard S. Middleton, & Yingnan Li. (2019). Environmental Performance Analysis of Cement Production with CO2 Capture and Storage Technology in a Life-Cycle Perspective. Sustainability 11, 2626.

Jing An, Richard S. Middleton, & Yingnan Li. (2019). Environmental Performance Analysis of Cement Production with CO2 Capture and Storage Technology in a Life-Cycle Perspective. Sustainability 11, 2626.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.samplingProcedure: The production capacity is set to produce 1 million tons of cement per year, with the proportion of clinker in cement products being 91%.
生产能力设定为每年生产1百万吨水泥，水泥产品中熟料的比例为91%。
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When using this data set for life cycle assessment, it is crucial to consider that the captured CO2 and the additional energy input required for the MEA regeneration process should be accounted for separately. The surplus electricity generated by the on-site Combined Heat and Power (CHP) plant is exported to the grid, and its environmental offsets are not accounted for in this data. Therefore, users must handle these aspects according to their specific methodological framework. Additionally, the impacts of NOx and SO2 on the MEA absorption process are indicated, recommending that these emissions be controlled before entering the CO2 capture unit. Use this data carefully within the context of the technological applicability and operational conditions stated.
在使用这份生命周期评估数据时，必须重点考虑所捕集的CO2和MEA再生过程所需的额外能源输入应当分别核算。现场热电联产（CHP）电厂生成的少量剩余电力被送往电网，其环境抵消并未在此数据中考虑。因此，用户必须根据他们特定的方法论框架处理这些方面。此外，数据指出NOx和SO2对MEA吸收过程的影响，建议在烟气进入CO2捕集单元前控制这些排放。在声明的技术适用性和操作条件的背景下谨慎使用这份数据。

completeness.common:other: There was a small electricity surplus in the combined heat and power (CHP) plant, which was sent to the electric grid. The offset of environmental impacts of surplus electricity were not considered.
热电联产电厂（Combined heat and power）有少量剩余电力，这些电力被输送到电网。没有考虑剩余电力对环境影响的抵消。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses

exchange.generalComment: Coal. Data taken from the technical report, IEA Greenhous Gas R&D Programme (IEA GHG). CO2 Capture in the Cement Industry. 2008. Available online: http://documents.ieaghg.org/index.php/s/YKm6B7zikUpPgGA?path=%2F2008 (accessed on 5 September 2017).

Particulates, <2.5um. Data taken from ecoinvent database, Ecoinvent Database v3. Available online: http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-33/ecoinvent-33.html (accessed on 15 April 2018). There was a 50% reduction in particulates for the post-combustion case due to the additional flue gas desulfurization (FDG) and selective catalytic reduction (SCR) processes.
颗粒<2.5um。数据来自ecoinvent数据库，版本为Ecoinvent Database v3。在线可获取链接：http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-33/ecoinvent-33.html（访问日期：2018年4月15日）。由于额外的烟气脱硫（FDG）和选择性催化还原（SCR）过程，后燃烧情况下颗粒物减少了50%。
